summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons memorandum detailing a possible suicide attempt by inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on July 23, 2019. The report includes conflicting accounts from Epstein and his cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, with Epstein alleging Tartaglione attempted to kill him, while Tartaglione claims he discovered Epstein with a string around his neck.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who allegedly attempted suicide and later accused his cellmate of attempting to kill him. He was found on the floor of his cell with a red neck and was placed on suicide watch.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate who reported the incident. He stated he discovered Epstein with a string around his neck, but Epstein later accused him of harassment and attempted murder.

connections.description: Were housed together in cell Z05-124LAD at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. Epstein accused Tartaglione of attempting to kill him and harassing him.

events.title: Possible Suicide Attempt by Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: At approximately 1:27 a.m., Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell lying on the floor, breathing heavily and snoring, with a red neck. He was placed on suicide watch after exhibiting unpredictable behavior and making allegations against his cellmate.

events.title: Epstein's Legal Visit
events.description: Epstein returned from a legal visit at approximately 8:00 p.m. the evening before the incident.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell on July 23, 2019, at 1:27 a.m. with a red neck, breathing heavily and snoring, in what was reported as a possible suicide attempt.
Epstein later accused his cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, of attempting to kill him and harassing him, claiming he had informed his attorney of the matter.
Tartaglione claimed he discovered Epstein with a string around his neck after feeling something hit his legs while he was asleep.
Epstein was examined by medical staff and found to have a circular line of erythema at the base of his neck with friction marks, and a small erythema on his left knee.
The report notes conflicting stories between Epstein and Tartaglione, with Tartaglione's account appearing inconsistent as if 'making the story up as he went along.'
